w:r.w:t: This lesson will teach basic greetings and polite expressions to the student when they are meeting someone. They will also be able to learn the basic instruction of underlining and circling objects that they can use in future lessons.
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Follow instruction to circle and underline appropriate answers to questions
hi, bye, bad, sad, fine, how are you
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be learning
ing to the tune of “Mary Had a
Look who came to school today.
Sing the song once for the student
Have the student sing the song if they can. Sing along with or for them to make it fun!
: Match the word with the picture
remind the student of these words they have learned in lesson 1.
See if they can match the word to the picture by drawing a line or circling their respective answers.

wp:docPr.name: Rectangle 31
wp:docPr.descr: Image result for girl clip art

w:r.w:t: Go over each of these names with the student.
pronounce the names and circle the picture of the picture to whom the name belongs.
Ask the student if they can tell you the names of the kids in the picture.
say the name or the sentence
Say the word for each object
Have the student draw a line from the directed objects to their corresponding objects.
Teach this song and its directions to the student
Go over these phrases with the student. Have the student repeat these phrases after you.
Have questioning expression (Shrug and puzzled look on face) while asking so student knows it is a question.
Teach the student the difference between circling and underlining as well as 4 and 1
Teach the student the difference between circling and underlining as well as the boy and the girl
Go over these sentences with the student. Read it aloud and help them find the answers from previous slides
Have the student circle their favorite color. (if they don’t have a favorite here, just ask them to remember the names of these colors)
Match the picture with their name.
Have the student match the word by underlining the picture and the word
Remind the student how to count to 5
Count the kids, birds, and shoes
Go over each of these expressions and point or circle the expressions to match the sentences. Have the student repeat each of these sentences back to you and mimic or circle the expressions.
This is the Way We Say Goodbye
This is the way we say goodbye,
This is the way we say goodbye,
We give our friends a big high five,
A big high five, a big high five,
We give our friends a big high five,
Sing the goodbye song with the student
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
How else can we say hello or goodbye?
Go over different ways to say hello or goodbye
Try to use these words in your own sentence!
name, hello, my, your, circle, underline
Work with the student to make short sentences out of each of these words
